newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil ABIOVE soybean crush 917,000 tonnes in Dec.
newsitem.headline: Brazil ABIOVE soybean crush 917,000 tonnes in Dec.

text.p: Brazilian firms contributing data to Brazilian Vegetable Oils Industries Association (ABIOVE) crushed 917,000 tonnes of soybeans in December, down from 1.3 million in November, ABIOVE said.

Total crushings in the first 11 months of the marketing year (February/January) now reached 17.89 million tonnes. ABIOVE estimates the data it receives represent between 84 and 86 percent of total Brazilian crushings.
As well as using domestic soybeans, Brazil imported a total of 989,000 tonnes between February and December, ABIOVE said.
The December figure left industry stocks at 751,000 tonnes, down from 1.34 million at the end of November.
Crushings last year in December when contributing companies represented 100 percent of the sector reached 1.48 million tonnes, according to ABIOVE statistics.
Soybean stocks at the end of the month in 1995 were 1.13 million tonnes.
